content: (The DreamWorks Pictures logo plays out, with dreamy music playing underneath. At the end of the logo, the S's in "DreamWorks" and "SKG" turn green and grow out ogre ears, matching the film's logo. Credits saying "DreamWorks Pictures Presents" and "A PDI/DreamWorks Production" appear.)
(A ray of light shines down on a leather-bound storybook. The book opens and a Scottish-accented voice begins reading its text)

Once upon a time there was a lovely princess. But she had an enchantment upon her of a fearful sort which could only be broken by love's first kiss. She was locked away in a castle guarded by a terrible fire-breathing dragon. Many brave knights had attempted to free her from this dreadful prison, but none prevailed. She waited in the dragon's keep in the highest room of the tallest tower. For her true love and true love's first kiss.
speaker: Shrek

content: (Shrek chuckles and rips out a page of the book and closes it)
Like that's ever gonna happen. What a load of - (toilet flushes)
speaker: Shrek

content: ("All Star" by Smash Mouth Playing)

(We see an outhouse and hear the sound of a toilet flushing. Out steps Shrek, an ogre, who tugs at his underwear and shakes his foot of the page still stuck to his shoe. He looks lovingly at the swamp he calls home, and goes about his daily routine. Which is taking a mud shower, brushing his teeth with bugs, bathing in a muddy pond, gathering giant slugs for dinner, and painting a warning sign)

(In a nearby village, an angry mob gather up to go after Shrek. At night they gather their torches and pitchforks and enter the swamp, trampling over Shrek's warning signs. Shrek sees them after investigating the commotion, rolling his eyes. The villagers stop outside Shrek's home, unaware that Shrek is sneaking up behind them)
NIGHT - NEAR SHREK'S SWAMP
Think it's in there?
speaker: Villager 1

content: All right. Let's get it!
speaker: Villager 2

content: Whoa. Hold on. Do you know what that thing can do to you?
speaker: Villager 1

content: Yeah, it'll grind your bones for its bread.
speaker: Villager 3

content: (Shrek chuckles, revealing himself to be standing behind the mob)
Yes, well, actually, that would be a giant.
speaker: Shrek

content: (The mob gasps)
Now, ogres, oh they're much worse. They'll make a suit from your freshly peeled skin...
speaker: Shrek

content: (Shrek slowly approaches as the villagers back away in fear)
No!
speaker: Villager

content: They'll shave your liver. Squeeze the jelly from your eyes! Actually, it's quite good on toast.
speaker: Shrek

content: Back! Back, beast! Back! I warn ya!
speaker: Villager 1

content: (The villager waves his torch in Shrek's face. Shrek casually licks his fingers and pinches the flame, extinguishing the torch. The villager drops it)
Right.
speaker: Villager 1

content: (Shrek terrifies the mob with a great frightening roar, his spit extinguishing all the remaining torches. He wipes his mouth and waits for the villagers to stop screaming)
(whispering) This is the part where you run away.
speaker: Shrek

content: (gasping)
speaker: Villagers

content: (Shrek laughs as the men drop their torches and pitchforks and run away as fast they can)
And stay out!
speaker: Shrek

content: (He looks down and picks up a wanted poster dropped by one of the villagers. He reads it aloud)
"Wanted. Fairytale creatures"?
speaker: SHREK

content: (He sighs and walks off. dropping the poster to the ground)
THE NEXT DAY - FOREST

Fairy tale creatures are put in chains and led into wagons by Duloc Guards. The Captain of the Duloc Guards sits at a table paying a line of people their rewards for turning in the fairytale creatures. Those waiting in line include Peter Pan, who is carrying Tinkerbell in a cage, Geppetto who is carrying Pinocchio, and a farmer carrying the Three Little Pigs.
All right. This one's full. Take it away! Move it along. Come on! Get up!
speaker: Guard

content: Next!
speaker: The Captain

content: (Taking the witch's broom) Give me that! Your flying days are over. (breaks the broom in half)
speaker: Guard

content: That's 20 pieces of silver for the witch. Next!
speaker: The Captain

content: (The captain hands over the reward to the villager who turned the witch in. The villager mutters to himself)
Lousy 20 pieces.
speaker: Villager

content: Get up! Come on!
speaker: Guard

content: (Waiting in line is Donkey on a leash and his owner. He looks in horror at the witch and a group of dwarves being loaded into a wagon)
Sit down there! Keep quiet!
speaker: Guard

content: Mama Bear and Papa Bear are locked inside giant cages, with Little Bear in his own cage
(crying) This cage is too small.
speaker: Little Bear

content: (To his owner) Please, don't turn me in. I'll never be stubborn again. I can change. Please! Give me another chance!
speaker: Donkey

content: Oh, shut up. (smacks Donkey)
speaker: Old Woman

content: Next! What have you got?
speaker: The Captain

content: This little wooden puppet.
speaker: Geppetto

content: I'm not a puppet. I'm a real boy. (his nose grows)
speaker: Pinocchio

content: 5 shillings for the possessed toy. Take it away.
speaker: The Captain

content: Father, please! Don't let them do this! Help me!
speaker: Pinocchio

content: (Geppetto takes the money and walks off. The old woman steps up to the table)
Next! What have you got?
speaker: The Captain

content: Well, I've got a talking donkey.
speaker: Old Woman

content: Right. Well, that's good for 10 shillings. If you can prove it.
speaker: The Captain

content: Oh, go ahead, little fella. (Donkey stays silent)
speaker: Old Woman

content: Well?
speaker: The Captain

content: Oh, oh, he's just...he's just a little nervous. He's really quite a chatterbox. (Smacks Donkey again) Talk, you boneheaded dolt, talk!
speaker: Old Woman

content: That's it. I've heard enough. Guards!
speaker: The Captain

content: No, no, he talks! He does. (Moving Donkey's lips) I can talk. I love to talk. I'm the talking-est damn thing you ever saw.
speaker: Old Woman

content: Get her out of my sight.
speaker: The Captain

content: No, no! I swear! Oh! He can talk!
speaker: Old Woman

content: (The guards grab the old woman and she struggles with them. One of her legs flies out and kicks Tinkerbell out of Peter Pan's hands, and her cage drops on Donkey's head. He gets sprinkled with fairy dust and starts floating upwards)
Hey! I can fly!
speaker: Donkey

content: He can fly!
speaker: Peter Pan

content: He can fly!
speaker: 3 Little Pigs

content: He can talk!
speaker: The Captain

content: Ha, ha! That's right, fool! Now I'm a flying, talking donkey. You might have seen a housefly, maybe even a superfly but I bet you ain't never seen a donkey fly. Ha, ha! (The pixie dust's effects begin to wear off) Uh-oh. (He drops out of the air and hits the ground with a thud)
speaker: Donkey

content: Seize him!
speaker: The Captain

content: (Donkey dodges the guards as they try to grab him and runs deeper into the forest)
After him! He's getting away! Get him! This way! Turn!
speaker: Guards

content: (Donkey escapes deeper into the forest and runs head first into Shrek's backside. Shrek turns around to see who bumped into him and glares down at Donkey. Donkey looks scared of Shrek for a moment, but he quickly hides behind him after seeing that the guards have caught up to him)
You there. Ogre!
speaker: The Captain

content: Aye?
speaker: Shrek

content: By the order of Lord Farquaad, I am authorized to place you both under arrest and...(Shrek slowly approaches the group of guards, the guards visibly frightened by him) transport you to... a designated...resettlement...facility?
speaker: The Captain

content: Oh, really? You and what army? (smiles)
speaker: Shrek

content: (The Captain looks behind himself and sees that all the other guards have abandoned him. The Captain tucks tail and runs off. Shrek shakes his head and starts walking back to his swamp. Donkey, impressed by Shrek, follows him)
Can I say something to you? Listen, you was really, really, really somethin' back here. Incredible!
speaker: Donkey

content: Are you talking to...(he turns around and Donkey is gone) me? (he turns back around and Donkey is right in front of him) Whoa!
speaker: Shrek

content: Yes. I was talking to you. Can I tell you that you that you was great back there? Man those guards! They thought they was all of that. Then you showed up and bam! They was tripping over themselves like babes in the woods. That really made me feel good to see that.
speaker: Donkey

content: (annoyed) Oh, that's great. Really.
speaker: Shrek

content: Man, it's good to be free.
speaker: Donkey

content: Now, why don't you go celebrate your freedom with your own friends? Hmm?
speaker: Shrek

content: But, uh, I don't have any friends. And I'm not goin' out there by myself. Hey, wait a minute! I got a great idea! I'll stick with you. You're a mean, green, fighting machine. Together we'll scare the spit out of anybody that crosses us.
speaker: Donkey

content: (Shrek turns and regards Donkey for a moment before loudly roaring in his face)

Oh, wow! That was really scary. If you don't mind me saying, if that don't work, your breath certainly will get the job done, 'cause you definitely need some Tic Tacs or something, 'cause your breath stinks!
speaker: Donkey

content: (Shrek walks off. Donkey reappears ahead of him, dangling from a felled log)

Man, you almost burned the hair outta my nose, just like the time...(Shrek covers his mouth but Donkey continues to talk. Shrek removes his hand) ...then I ate some rotten berries. I had strong gases leaking out of my butt that day.
speaker: Donkey

content: Why are you following me?
speaker: Shrek

content: I'll tell you why. (drops from the log. Singing) "'Cause I'm all alone, There's no one here beside me, My problems have all gone, There's no one to deride me, But you gotta have friends..."
speaker: Donkey

content: Stop singing! (picks up Donkey by his ears and tail) Well, it's no wonder you don't have any friends (drops him)
speaker: Shrek

content: Wow. Only a true friend would be that truly honest.
speaker: Donkey

content: Listen, little donkey. Take a look at me. What am I?
speaker: Shrek

content: (looks all the way up at Shrek) Uh...really tall?
speaker: Donkey

content: No! I'm an ogre! You know, "Grab your torch and pitchforks." Doesn't that bother you?
speaker: Shrek

content: (shakes his head) Nope.
speaker: Donkey

content: (surprised) Really?
speaker: Shrek

content: Really, really.
speaker: Donkey

content: (taken aback) Oh.
speaker: Shrek

content: Man, I like you. What's your name?
speaker: Donkey

content: Uh, Shrek.
speaker: Shrek

content: Shrek? Well, you know what I like about you, Shrek? You got that kind of "I-don't-care-what-nobody-thinks-of-me" thing. I like that. I respect that, Shrek. You're all right. (they come over a hill overlooking Shrek's swamp) Woo, look at that! Who'd want to live in place like that?
speaker: Donkey

content: (annoyed) That would be my home.
speaker: Shrek

content: Oh! And it is lovely! Just beautiful. You know you are quite a decorator. It's amazing what you've done with such a modest budget. I like that boulder. That is a nice boulder. (looks at Shrek's "keep out" signs) I guess you don't entertain much, do you?
speaker: Donkey

content: I like my privacy.
speaker: Shrek

content: You know, I do too. That's another thing we have in common. Like I hate it when you got somebody in your face. You're trying to give them a hint and they won't leave. And there's that big awkward silence you know? (awkward silence) Can I stay with you?
speaker: Donkey

content: Uh, what?
speaker: Shrek

content: Can I stay with you, please?
speaker: Donkey

content: (sarcastically) Of course!
speaker: Shrek

content: Really?
speaker: Donkey

content: No.
speaker: Shrek

content: Please! I don't wanna go back there! You don't know what it's like to be considered a freak. (Donkey pushes Shrek up against the door) Well, maybe you do. But that's why we gotta stick together. You gotta let me stay! Please! Please!
speaker: Donkey

content: Okay! Okay. But one night only.
speaker: Shrek

content: Ah! Thank you! (he runs inside the hut)
speaker: Donkey

content: Ah! What are you...no! (Donkey hops up onto a chair.) No!
speaker: Shrek

content: This is gonna be fun! We can stay up late, swapping manly stories, and in the morning... I'm making waffles.
speaker: Donkey

content: (growls in frustration)
speaker: Shrek

content: Where do, uh, I sleep?
speaker: Donkey

content: (irritated) Outside!
speaker: Shrek

content: Oh, well, I guess that's cool. I mean, I don't know you, and you don't know me, so I guess outside is best, you know. Here I go. Good night. (Shrek slams the door, shutting Donkey outside) I mean, I do like the outdoors. I'm a donkey. I was born outside. I'll just be sitting by myself outside, I guess, you know. By myself, outside. I'm all alone...there's no one here beside me...
speaker: Donkey

content: SHREK'S HOME - NIGHT

(Shrek is getting ready for dinner. He sits down, lights a candle made out of his own earwax, and begins eating. Donkey looks inside from a window, and then lays down by the front door. Shrek is about to take a bite when he hears a creaking noise. He stands up with a huff)
(to Donkey) I thought I told you to stay outside!
speaker: Shrek

content: (from the window) I am outside!
speaker: Donkey

content: (Shrek hears a noise from inside and turns to find the source. He sees several shadows moving and looks around. He sees the 3 Blind Mice on his table)
Well, gents, it's a far cry from the farm, but what choice do we have?
speaker: Mouse 1

content: It's not home, but it'll do just fine.
speaker: Mouse 2

content: (bouncing on a slug) What a lovely bed.
speaker: Gorder

content: Got ya. (grabs Gorder, but he escapes and lands on his shoulder)
speaker: Shrek

content: I found some cheese. (bites into Shrek's ear)
speaker: Gorder

content: Ow! (tries to grab him)
speaker: Shrek

content: Blah! Awful stuff. (jumps down to the table)
speaker: Gorder

content: Is that you, Gorder?
speaker: Blind Mouse

content: How did you know?
speaker: Gorder

content: Enough! (he grabs all 3 mice) What are you doing in my house? (He gets bumped from behind and he drops the mice) Hey!
speaker: Shrek

content: (Shrek turns around and sees that the 7 Dwarves have put Snow White, sleeping in her glass coffin, on the table)
Oh, no, no, no. Dead broad off the table! (pushes the coffin away)
speaker: Shrek

content: Where are we supposed to put her? The bed's taken.
speaker: Dwarf

content: (confused) Huh?
speaker: Shrek

content: (Shrek walks over to the bedroom and throws back the curtain. The Big Bad Wolf is laying in the bed)
What?
speaker: Big Bad Wolf

content: (Shrek now has the Big Bad Wolf by the collar and is dragging him to the front door)
I live in a swamp. I put up signs. I'm a terrifying ogre! What do I have to do get a little privacy?
speaker: Shrek

content: (He opens the front door and throws Big Bad Wolf out. He sees that a horde of fairytale creatures have set up camp in his swamp)
Oh, no. Oh, no. No! No! (he dodges out the way of a group of witches flying on broomsticks)
speaker: Shrek

content: (Papa Bear and Little Bear sit around the fire, the Pied Piper is playing his pipe and the rats are all running to him, some elves are directing flight traffic so that the fairies and witches can land)
WHAT ARE YOU DOING IN MY SWAMP?!!
speaker: Shrek

content: (Shrek's voice echoes throughout the camp and everyone falls silent. Gasps are heard all around. The 3 Good Fairies hide inside a tent)
All right, get out of here. All of you, move it! Come on! Let's go! Hapaya! Hapaya! Hey!
speaker: Shrek

content: Quickly. Come on!
speaker: Dwarves

content: (More dwarves run inside the house and shut the door behind them)
No, no! No, no. Not there! Not there!
speaker: Shrek

content: (Shrek fiddles with the door handle, unable to open the door. He gives Donkey an annoyed look)
Hey, don't look at me. I didn't invite them.
speaker: Donkey

content: Well gosh, no one invited us.
speaker: Pinocchio

content: What?!
speaker: Shrek

content: We were forced to come here!
speaker: Pinocchio

content: By who?!
speaker: Shrek

content: Lord Farquaad. He huffed and he puffed and he...signed an eviction notice.
speaker: Little Pig

content: (sighs) Alright. Who knows where this... "Farquaad" guy is?
speaker: Shrek

content: (The crowd gasps at the mention of Lord Farquaad. No one answers)
Oh, I do. I know where he is!
speaker: Donkey

content: Does anyone else know where to find him?
speaker: Shrek

content: (Little Bear raises his hand but Papa Bear quickly puts his hand down. Big Bad Wolf and a wizard point at each other)
Anyone at all?
speaker: Shrek

content: Me! Me!
speaker: Donkey

content: Anyone?
speaker: Shrek

content: (jumping up and down) Oh! Oh, pick me! Oh, I know! I know! Me, me!
speaker: Donkey

content: (sighs) Okay, fine. Attention all...fairy tale things. Do not get comfortable! Your welcome is officially worn out! In fact, I'm gonna see this guy Farquaad right now and get you all off my land and back where you came from!
speaker: SHREK

content: (After a brief silence, the crowd erupts into cheering and applause. This was not Shrek's intention. A group of birds drapes a cloak made of flowers around Shrek's shoulders, much to his annoyance)
Oh! (to Donkey) You! You're coming with me.
speaker: Shrek

content: (Shrek brushes the cloak onto the ground, while the birds come back to place a wreath of flowers on Donkey's head. They make their through the crowd)
All right, that's what I like to hear, man. Shrek and Donkey, 2 stalwart friends, off on a whirlwind big-city adventure. I love it!
speaker: Donkey

content: (singing) "On the road again...", sing it with me, Shrek!
speaker: Donkey

content: (as they walk away from the crowd Shrek grabs the torch from a dwarf cheering them on, who refuses to let go. Shrek shakes the torch until the dwarf falls into a pond)
"I can't wait to get on the road again."
speaker: Donkey

content: What did I say about singing? (yanks the wreath off Donkey's head)
speaker: Shrek

content: Can I whistle?
speaker: Donkey

content: No.
speaker: Shrek

content: Well, can I hum it?
speaker: Donkey

content: (annoyed) All right, hum it.
speaker: Shrek

content: (Donkey begins to hum 'On the Road Again'. The pair walk off into the night with Shrek's torch lighting the way)
DULOC - DUNGEON

(A masked man is pouring a glass of milk. Another man is shown walking down the hallway towards a set of doors. As he is let into the room by two guards, we can see that the man is abnormally short. The masked man is dunking what looks to be a small person into the glass of milk)
(stepping forward) That's enough. He's ready to talk.
speaker: Lord Farquaad

content: Gingy is pulled out of the milk by Thelonious and is slammed down onto a cookie sheet. Lord Farquaad laughs evilly as he walks over to the table. When he reaches the table we see that he is too short to see above it. He clears his throat and the table is lowered
(he picks up the Gingy's severed legs and plays with them) Run, run, run, as fast as you can. You can't catch me. I'm the gingerbread man!
speaker: Lord Farquaad

content: You're a monster!
speaker: Gingy

content: I'm not the monster here, you are. (throws one leg at Gingy) You and the rest of that fairy tale trash, poisoning my perfect world (crumbles his other leg into dust) Now, tell me! Where are the others?!
speaker: Lord Farquaad

content: Eat me! (spits at Lord Farquaad)
speaker: Gingy

content: Ugh! I've tried to be fair to you creatures. Now my patience has reached its end! Tell me or I'll...(he grabs one of Gingy's gumdrop buttons)
speaker: Lord Farquaad

content: No, no, not the buttons. Not my gumdrop buttons!
speaker: Gingy

content: All right then. Who's hiding them?
speaker: Lord Farquaad

content: Okay, I'll tell you. Do you know the muffin man?
speaker: Gingy

content: The muffin man?
speaker: Lord Farquaad

content: The muffin man.
speaker: Gingy

content: Yes, I know the muffin man. Who lives on Drury Lane?
speaker: Lord Farquaad

content: Well, she's married to the muffin man.
speaker: Gingy

content: (Shocked) The muffin man?
speaker: Lord Farquaad

content: The muffin man!
speaker: Gingy

content: She's married to the muffin man.
speaker: Lord Farquaad

content: (A door opens and the Captain of the Duloc Guards steps in)
My lord! We've found it.
speaker: The Captain

content: Then what are you waiting for? Bring it in!
speaker: Lord Farquaad

content: (More guards enter carrying an object covered by a sheet. They mount it on the wall and the Captain removes the sheet. It is the Magic Mirror. Everyone stands in awe)
Ohhhh...
speaker: Gingy

content: Magic mirror...
speaker: Lord Farquaad

content: Don't tell him anything! (Lord Farquaad smacks him off the table and into a trash can) No!
speaker: Gingy

content: Evening. Mirror, mirror on the wall, is this not the most perfect kingdom of them all?
speaker: Lord Farquaad

content: Well, technically you're not a king.
speaker: Magic Mirror

content: Uh, Thelonius. (Thelonius holds up a hand mirror and smashes it with his fist) You were saying?
speaker: Lord Farquaad

content: What I mean is you're not a king yet. But you can become one. All you have to do is marry a princess.
speaker: Magic Mirror

content: Go on.
speaker: Lord Farquaad

content: (chuckles nervously) So, just sit back and relax, my lord, because it's time for you to meet today's eligible bachelorettes. And...here they are!
speaker: Magic Mirror

content: (Bouncy gameshow music begins to play. Using himself as a screen, the Magic Mirror reveals three shadowy portraits of princesses. Lord Farquaad seems confused but watches on silently)

Bachelorette number 1 is a mentally abused shut-in from a kingdom far, far away. She likes sushi and hot tubbing anytime! Her hobbies include cooking and cleaning for her 2 evil sisters. Please welcome...Cinderella!
speaker: Magic Mirror

content: (An image of Cinderella doing housework flips to a portrait of Cinderella in her ball gown putting on the glass slipper. Lord Farquaad looks at her approvingly and the Captain claps)
Bachelorette number 2 is a cape-wearing girl from the land of fancy. Although she lives with 7 other men, she's not easy.
speaker: Magic Mirror

content: (An image of the 7 Dwarves flashes on the screen. The guards laugh at the Mirror's joke)
Just kiss her dead, frozen lips and find out what a live wire she is. Come on, give it up for Snow White!
speaker: Magic Mirror

content: (The mirror shows a portrait of Snow White in her slumber. Lord Farquaad seems even more pleased, and everyone else claps this time)
And last, but certainly not last, bachelorette number 3 is a fiery redhead from a dragon-guarded castle surrounded by hot boiling lava!
speaker: Magic Mirror

content: (The mirror shows an image of a giant dragon besides a tower and then of a giant castle surrounded by lava. A bright fire shines on the screen and Lord Farquaad covers his eyes. This doesn't seem to deter his interest)
But don't let that cool you off. She's a loaded pistol who likes piña coladas and getting caught in the rain. Yours for the rescuing, Princess Fiona!
speaker: Magic Mirror

content: (The mirror shows a portrait of Princess Fiona leaning on the window of her tower. Once again everyone else claps)
So, will it be: bachelorette number 1, bachelorette number 2, or bachelorette number 3?
speaker: Magic Mirror

content: (The mirrors flips through each princesses' portrait. The guards shout out different numbers while Lord Farquaad frantically tries to decide)
(to himself) 2? 3? 1? 3?
speaker: Lord Farquaad

content: 3! (holds up 2 fingers) Pick number 3, my lord!
speaker: Thelonius

content: Okay, okay, uh... number 3!
speaker: Lord Farquaad

content: Lord Farquaad, you've chosen Princess Fiona.
speaker: Magic Mirror

content: (Wild applause erupts from the guards. Lord Farquaad is captivated by the portrait of Fiona)
Princess...Fiona...she's perfect. All I have to do is just find someone who can go...
speaker: Lord Farquaad

content: But I probably should mention the little thing that happens at night.
speaker: Magic Mirror

content: (Lord Farquaad doesn't listen to the mirror at all, too busy formulating a plan)
I'll do it.
speaker: Lord Farquaad

content: Yes, but after sunset...
speaker: Magic Mirror

content: Silence! I will make this Princess Fiona my queen, and Duloc will finally have the perfect king! Captain, assemble your finest men. We're going to have a tournament! (grins evilly)
speaker: Lord Farquaad

content: DULOC KINGDOM - EXTERIOR
(Shrek and Donkey come out of the field just outside the Duloc parking lot)
But that's it. That's it right there. That's Duloc. I told ya I'd find it.
speaker: Donkey

content: (The 2 gaze up at Duloc Castle, a building that towers over the rest of the kingdom)
So, that must be Lord Farquaad's castle.
speaker: Shrek

content: Uh-huh. That's the place.
speaker: Donkey

content: Do you think maybe he's compensating for something?
speaker: Shrek

content: (Shrek laughs, but then groans as Donkey doesn't get the joke. He continues walking through the parking lot)
Hey, wait. Wait up, Shrek.
speaker: Donkey

content: Hurry, darling. We're late. Hurry!
speaker: Man

content: (A man and woman run through the castle's entrance. In front of the gate is a series of ropes hung in a maze for crowd control. A mascot wearing a giant head resembling Lord Farquaad stands at the end of the line. Shrek and Donkey exchange looks)
Hey, you!
speaker: Shrek

content: (The mascot screams at the sight of Shrek and begins running through the roped path to get to the front gate)
Wait a second. Look, I'm not gonna eat you. I just-- I just --
speaker: Shrek

content: (Shrek sighs in frustration and then begins pushing his way through the ropes. The mascot runs into a wall and knocks himself out. Shrek pushes through the entrance's turnstile, but Donkey gets caught in it and lands on the ground with a thud. Donkey sheepishly smiles and Shrek sighs in annoyance)
DULOC - INTERIOR

(Shrek and Donkey look around the square, which is deserted. The trees and grass are neatly cut and the rows of houses all looked exactly the same. Chirpy music quietly plays from a set of loudspeakers)
It's quiet. Too quiet. Where is everybody?
speaker: Shrek

content: Hey, look at this!
speaker: Donkey

content: (Donkey runs over and pulls a lever that is attached to a box marked 'Information'. The music winds up and then the box doors open up. There are little wooden people inside and they begin to sing)

Welcome to Duloc such a perfect town / Here we have some rules let us lay them down / Don't make waves, stay in line and we'll get along  fine / Duloc is perfect place / Please keep off of the grass / Shine your shoes, wipe your... face / Duloc is, Duloc is / Duloc is perfect place.
speaker: Wooden People

content: (Suddenly a camera takes Shrek and Donkey's picture, both of which are dumbfounded)
Wow! Let's do that again!
speaker: Donkey

content: (Donkey makes ready to run over and pull the lever again but Shrek quickly grabs him by the tail)
No! No! No, no, no! (whispers) No.
speaker: Shrek

content: (They hear a trumpet fanfare from afar and head over to investigate. A voice sounds from the distance)
Brave knights! You are the best and brightest in all the land, and today one of you shall prove himself better and brighter than all the rest.
speaker: Lord Farquaad

content: (As Shrek and Donkey walk down the tunnel to get into the arena, Donkey hums the Duloc theme song)
All right, you're going the right way for a smacked bottom.
speaker: Shrek

content: Sorry about that.
speaker: Donkey

content: ARENA

(In the center of a stadium-like arena, Duloc Knights are gathered as a large crowd of citizens watches on from the stands. Horses, kegs of beer, arrow targets, and other equipment are scattered about. Farquaad is atop a high up balcony, flanked by two guards, addressing the crowd. Shrek and Donkey step out onto the arena but don't seem to be noticed)

That champion shall have the honor-- no, no -- the privilege to go forth and rescue the lovely Princess Fiona from the fiery keep of the dragon. If for any reason the winner is unsuccessful, the first runner-up will take his place. And so on and so forth. Some of you may die, but it's a sacrifice I am willing to make.
speaker: Lord Farquaad

content: (The crowd cheers and applauds. Shrek looks around, noticing a man holding up a cue card up to the crowd that reads "APPLAUSE")
Let the tournament begin!
speaker: Lord Farquaad

content: (Shrek marches through the Duloc Knights, who back away in disgust upon noticing him)
Oh! What is that? It's hideous!
speaker: Lord Farquaad

content: (The crowd gasps and goes quiet)
Ah, that's not very nice (looks at Donkey and then back at Lord Farquaad) It's just a donkey.
speaker: Shrek

content: (Donkey looks confused, the joke is once again lost on him)
Indeed. Knights, new plan! The one who kills the ogre will be named champion! Have at him!
speaker: Lord Farquaad

content: (Lord Farquaad points at Shrek. The Duloc Knights draw their weapons and slowly approach Shrek as he backs up, the crowd cheering them on)
Get him!
speaker: Crowd

content: Oh, hey! Now come on! Hang on now. (He bumps into a table, noticing mugs of ale)
speaker: Shrek

content: Go ahead! Get him!
speaker: Crowd

content: (holds up a mug of ale) Can't we just settle this over a pint?
speaker: Shrek

content: Kill the beast!
speaker: Crowd

content: No? All right then. (drinks the ale in one gulp) Come on!
speaker: Shrek

content: (Shrek takes the mug and smashes the spigot off the large barrel of ale behind him. The ale comes rushing out, knocking the knights down and wetting the ground into mud. Shrek slides past the knights and uses a spear like a hockey stick to knock one off his feet. Donkey hops up onto one of the larger beer barrels. It breaks free of its ropes and begins to roll. Donkey manages to squish 2 knights into the mud and rolls over another group of knights running after Shrek. Shrek hops over a set of ropes that appears to make up a wrestling ring. Shrek uses the ropes to launch himself at 2 knights, knocking them over with his arms. The crowd boos. Shrek jump kicks a knight, and then body slams another. A knight comes from behind Shrek with his spear ready to attack. The crowd gasps, but before he can make a move Shrek puts him in a full-nelson hold)
Hey, Shrek, tag me! Tag me!
speaker: Donkey

content: (Shrek brings the knight over to Donkey, who leans on the ropes and headbutts the knight. Shrek gets up on the ropes and interacts with the crowd, who have now begun to cheer for Shrek and Donkey. Shrek stands on top of the ropes and beckons on the crowd's cheers)
Yeah!
speaker: Shrek

content: (A knight tries to sneak up behind Shrek, but he turns in time to sees him and jumps on him)
The chair! Give him the chair!
speaker: Woman

content: (Shrek uses a folding chair to smack the knight lying on the ground. Shrek dispatches a few more knights with ease. Shrek picks up the last knight, spinning him over his head and then throwing him against the post of the wrestling ring. Donkey kicks his helmet, and the ding sounds the end of the match. Finally all the knights are down. The audience goes wild)
Oh, yeah! Ah! Ah! Thank you! Thank you very much! I'm here till Thursday. Try the veal! Ha, ha! (laughs)
speaker: Shrek

content: (Lord Farquaad motions to the guards, who aim their crossbows at Shrek and Donkey. The crowd gasps and goes silent. Shrek stops laughing)
Shall I give the order, sir?
speaker: Guard

content: No, I have a better idea. People of Duloc! I give you our champion!
speaker: Lord Farquaad

content: (The crowd cheers and a fanfare plays)
What?
speaker: Shrek

content: Congratulations, ogre. You've won the honor of embarking on a great and noble quest.
speaker: Lord Farquaad

content: Quest? I'm already on a quest. A quest to get my swamp back.
speaker: Shrek

content: Your swamp?
speaker: Lord Farquaad

content: Yeah, my swamp! Where you dumped those fairy tale creatures!
speaker: Shrek

content: Indeed. All right, ogre. I'll make you a deal. Go on this quest for me, and I'll give you your swamp back.
speaker: Lord Farquaad

content: Exactly the way it was?
speaker: Shrek

content: Down to the last slime-covered toadstool.
speaker: Lord Farquaad

content: And the squatters?
speaker: Shrek

content: As good as gone.
speaker: Lord Farquaad

content: (Shrek glances at the soldiers still aiming their crossbows and then turns back to Lord Farquaad)
What kind of quest?
speaker: Shrek

content: DULOC  - EXTERIOR
(Shrek and Donkey are now walking through the fields heading away from Duloc. Shrek is munching on an onion)

Let me get this straight. You're gonna go fight a dragon and rescue a princess just so Farquaad will give you back a swamp which you only don't have because he filled it full of freaks in the first place. Is that about right?
speaker: Donkey

content: You know, maybe there's a good reason donkeys shouldn't talk.
speaker: Shrek

content: I don't get it. Why don't you just pull some of that ogre stuff on him? Throttle him, lay siege to his fortress, grinds his bones to make your bread, the whole ogre trip.
speaker: Donkey

content: Oh, I know what. Maybe I could have decapitated an entire village and put their heads on a pike, gotten a knife, cut open their spleen and drink their fluids. Does that sound good to you?
speaker: Shrek

content: Uh, no, not really, no.
speaker: Donkey

content: For your information, there's a lot more to ogres than people think.
speaker: Shrek

content: Example?
speaker: Donkey

content: Example? Okay, um, ogres are like onions. (he holds out his onion)
speaker: Shrek

content: (sniffs the onion) They stink?
speaker: Donkey

content: Yes - - No!
speaker: Shrek

content: They make you cry?
speaker: Donkey

content: No!
speaker: Shrek

content: Oh, you leave them in the sun, they get all brown, start sproutin' little white hairs.
speaker: Donkey

content: No! Layers! Onions have layers. Ogres have layers! Onions have layers. You get it? We both have layers. (he throws away the onion and walks off)
speaker: Shrek

content: (trailing after Shrek) Oh, you both have layers. Oh. {sniffs} You know, not everybody likes onions. Cake! Everybody loves cakes! Cakes have layers.
speaker: Donkey

content: I don't care... what everyone likes. Ogres are not like cakes. (walks passed Donkey)
speaker: Shrek

content: You know what else everybody likes? Parfaits. Have you ever met a person, you say, "Let's get some parfait," they say, "Hell no, I don't like no parfaits"? Parfaits are delicious.
speaker: Donkey

content: (Yelling) NO! You bad, irritating, miniature beast of burden! Ogres are like onions! End of story. Bye-bye. (whispers) See you later.
speaker: Shrek

content: Parfaits may be the most delicious thing on the whole damn planet.
speaker: Donkey

content: You know, I think I preferred your humming.
speaker: Shrek

content: Do you have a tissue or something? I'm making a mess. Just the word parfait makes me start slobbering.
speaker: Donkey

content: (They head off. There is a montage of their journey. Walking through a field at sunset. Sleeping beneath a bright moon. Shrek burns his foot trying to stomp out the campfire, so Donkey urinates on the fire to put it out. They arrive at the outskirts of a giant volcano and begin to make their way up)
(sniffs) Whew! Shrek! Did you do that? You gotta warn somebody before you just crack one off. My mouth was open and everything.
speaker: Donkey

content: Believe me, Donkey, if it was me, you'd be dead. (sniffs) It's brimstone. We must be getting close.
speaker: Shrek

content: Yeah, right, brimstone. Don't be talking about it's the brimstone. I know what I smell. It wasn't no brimstone. It didn't come off no stone neither.
speaker: Donkey

content: (They reach the top of the climb and hoist themselves up and over the ridge)
DRAGON'S KEEP -  EXTERIOR

(Shrek and Donkey gaze out into the crater. The Dragon's Keep towered before them, a dilapidated castle, burned and blackened. Perched on a rock pinnacle, it was surrounded by a terrifying lake of molten lava. A single light shines in the window of the tallest tower. Dark clouds block out the blue sky above them. Thunder strikes and crows circling the castle can be heard. It's all very ominous)
Sure, it's big enough, but look at the location. (laughs)
speaker: Shrek

content: (Shrek jumps over and approaches the bridge, with Donkey joining in behind him)
(chuckes along nervously) Uh, Shrek? Uh, remember when you said that ogres have layers?
speaker: Donkey

content: Oh, aye.
speaker: Shrek

content: Well, I have a bit of a confession to make (gasps, seeing the skeleton of a horse). Donkeys don't have layers. We wear our fear right out there on our sleeves.
speaker: Donkey

content: Wait a second. Donkeys don't have sleeves.
speaker: Shrek

content: You know what I mean.
speaker: Donkey

content: Oh, you can't tell me you're afraid of heights.
speaker: Shrek

content: No, I'm just a little uncomfortable about being on a rickety bridge over a boiling lake of lava!
speaker: Donkey

content: Come on, Donkey. I'm right here beside ya, okay? For emotional support. We'll just tackle this thing together one little baby step at a time.
speaker: Shrek

content: Really?
speaker: Donkey

content: Really, really.
speaker: Shrek

content: Okay, that makes me feel so much better.
speaker: Donkey

content: Just keep moving. And don't look down.
speaker: Shrek

content: (nervously to himself) Okay, don't look down. Don't look down. Don't look down. Keep on moving. Don't look down.
speaker: Donkey

content: (Donkey accidentally steps through a rotting board, which falls down into the fiery lava below)
Shrek! I'm lookin' down! (screams) Oh, God, I can't do this! Just let me off, please!
speaker: Donkey

content: But you're already halfway.
speaker: Shrek

content: But I know that half is safe!
speaker: Donkey

content: Okay, fine. I don't have time for this. You go back.
speaker: Shrek

content: (Shrek tries to press on while Donkey tries to make his way back under Shrek)
Shrek, no! Wait!
speaker: Donkey

content: Just, Donkey - - Let's have a dance then, shall we? (bounces and sways the bridge)
speaker: Shrek

content: Don't do that!
speaker: Donkey

content: Oh, I'm sorry. Do what? Oh, this? (bounces the bridge again)
speaker: Shrek

content: Yes, that!
speaker: Donkey

content: Yes? Yes, do it. Okay. (continues to bounce and sway as he backs Donkey across the bridge)
speaker: Shrek

content: No, Shrek! No! Stop it!
speaker: Donkey

content: You said do it! I'm doing it.
speaker: Shrek

content: I'm gonna die. I'm gonna die. Shrek, I'm gonna die. (steps onto solid ground) Oh!
speaker: Donkey

content: That'll do, Donkey. That'll do. (walks towards the castle)
speaker: Shrek

content: Cool. So where is this fire-breathing pain-in-the-neck anyway?
speaker: Donkey

content: Inside, waiting for us to rescue her. (chuckles)
speaker: Shrek

content: I was talkin' about the dragon, Shrek.
speaker: Donkey

content: DRAGON'S KEEP - INTERIOR

(The pair start making their way through the hallways of the dragon's dark and spooky keep. Shrek is wary, while Donkey is downright terrified. Only an occasional torch lights the way. The passages are littered with bones, armor, and weapons, presumably belonging to the many unsuccessful knights who tried to rescue the princess)
You afraid?
speaker: Donkey

content: No. But...SHHHHHH. (shushes Donkey)
speaker: Shrek

content: Oh, good. Me neither. (Get spooked and gasps) 'Cause there's nothing wrong with being afraid. Fear's a sensible response to an unfamiliar situation. Unfamiliar dangerous situation, I might add. With a dragon that breathes fire and eats knights and breathes fire. It sure doesn't mean you're a coward if you're a little scared. I sure as heck ain't no coward. I know that.
speaker: Donkey

content: (Donkey crashes into a pile of knight remains, knocking over a skeleton whose helmet lands on Donkey's head. The skeleton head falls off and Donkey gasps)
Donkey, 2 things, okay? Shut. Up. Now go over there and see if you can find any stairs (grabs the helmet and puts it on)
speaker: Shrek

content: Stairs? I thought we was looking for the princess.
speaker: Donkey

content: (picking up pieces of armor) The princess will be up the stairs in the highest room in the tallest tower.
speaker: Shrek

content: What makes you think she'll be there?
speaker: Donkey

content: I read it in a book once. (walks off)
speaker: Shrek

content: Cool. You handle the dragon. I'll handle the stairs. I'll find those stairs. I'll whip their butt too. Those stairs won't know which way they're going.
speaker: Donkey

content: (Shrek, now disguised as a knight in shining armor walks off further into the castle. Donkey wanders off in the opposite direction, still talking to himself, and pushes his way through a giant set of doors)
I'm gonna take drastic steps. Kick it to the curb. Don't mess with me. I'm the stair master. I've mastered the stairs. I wish I had a step right here. I'd step all over it.
speaker: Donkey

content: (Behind a broken wall, a giant eye opens to see an unaware Donkey. Elsewhere, Shrek spots a light in the window of a tower)
Well, at least we know where the princess is. But where's the...
speaker: Shrek

content: Dragon!
speaker: Donkey

content: (Donkey screams and takes off running, narrowly dodging the dragon's fiery breath. The dragon chases after Donkey, stomping on the pile of knight remains in her way. Shrek turns around to see Donkey barreling towards him with the dragon close behind him)
Donkey, look out!
speaker: Shrek

content: (Shrek manages to grab Donkey out of the way just as the dragon breathes another fireball. Donkey drops to the floor to avoid another fireball, which manages to singe the tuft of his tail. The dragon is just about to eat Donkey when Shrek grabs ahold of her tail)
Got ya!
speaker: Shrek

content: (The dragon begins to swing her tail back and forth with Shrek still holding on, then launches him into the air. Shrek crashes through the roof of the tallest tower and into Fiona's room. Fiona wakes up and looks at him lying on the floor unconscious. The dragon now focuses her attention on Donkey, breathing fire at him and forcing him onto a stone bridge. The dragon knocks down portions of the bridge until Donkey is left staying on a lone pillar)
No. Oh, no, No! (the dragon growls) Oh, what large teeth you have! (the dragon roars) I mean white, sparkling teeth!
speaker: Donkey

content: (The dragon pauses, looks at him inquisitively, and then smiles. Donkey might just flatter his way out of becoming dragon food)
I know you probably hear this all time from your food, but you must bleach, 'cause that is one dazzling smile you got there. Do I detect a hint of minty freshness?
speaker: Donkey

content: (The dragon appears to be flattered by Donkey's compliments)
And you know what else? You know what else? You're-- You're--
speaker: Donkey

content: (The dragon leans forward and gazes at Donkey, revealing its long eyelashes and lipsticked mouth. Suddenly it was all clear to Donkey)
--a girl dragon! Oh, sure! I mean, of course you're a girl dragon. You're just reeking of feminine beauty.
speaker: Donkey

content: (The dragon flutters her eyes at him)
What's the matter with you? You got something in your eye?
speaker: Donkey

content: (Dragon blows a heart-shaped smoke ring at Donkey)
Ohh. Oh. Oh. Man, I'd really love to stay, but you know, I'm, uh...(coughs) I'm an asthmatic, and I don't know if it'd work out if you're gonna blow smoke rings and stuff. Shrek!
speaker: Donkey

content: (Dragon picks him up by the tail in her mouth and happily carries him off)
No! Shrek! Shrek! Shrek!
speaker: Donkey

content: FIONA'S TOWER - INTERIOR

(Shrek groans as he regains consciousness. His back is to a Princess Fiona, laying upright on the bed near the window. Though a bit startled, she is ecstatic to see her knight-in-shining armor. She straightens her dress, lays back down, and then quickly reaches over for bouquet of flowers off the side table. She lays back down and pretends to be asleep, clutching the bouquet to her breast. Shrek turns, takes note of the princess and walks across the room over to her. He bends down over to Fiona and she puckers her lips. Shrek takes her by the shoulders and forcefully shakes her)
Wha...Wha...
speaker: Fiona

content: Wake up!
speaker: Shrek

content: What?!
speaker: Fiona

content: Are you Princess Fiona?
speaker: Shrek

content: I am... (smiling) awaiting a knight so bold as to rescue me.
speaker: Fiona

content: Ah, that's nice. Now let's go!
speaker: Shrek

content: (Shrek turns to leave and Fiona quickly sits upright)
But wait, Sir Knight! This be-ith our first meeting. Should it not be a wonderful, romantic moment?
speaker: Fiona

content: (she tosses the bouquet and lays back down, swooning)
Yeah, sorry, lady. There's no time.
speaker: Shrek

content: (Shrek walks back, yanks Fiona's arm. and hauls her out of bed and towards the door)
Hey, wait. What are you doing? You know, you should sweep me off my feet out yonder window and down a rope onto your valiant steed.
speaker: Fiona

content: (Shrek yanks on the door handle only for it to snap off)
You've had a lot of time to plan this, haven't you?
speaker: Shrek

content: Mm-hmm.
speaker: Fiona

content: (Fiona screams as Shrek suddenly smashes the door down with his shoulder, still holding onto her arm. He rushes down the tower's staircase with Fiona in tow and grabs a torch)
But we have to savor this moment! You could recite an epic poem for me.
speaker: Fiona

content: DRAGON'S KEEP - INTERIOR
(Shrek and Fiona cross the bridge connecting the tallest tower to the rest of the castle)
A ballad? A sonnet! A limerick? Or something!
speaker: Fiona

content: (Fiona pulls her arm from Shrek's grip. They stop for a moment as Shrek figures out which direction to go)
I don't think so.
speaker: Shrek

content: Well, can I at least know the name of my champion?
speaker: Fiona

content: Uh, Shrek.
speaker: Shrek

content: Sir Shrek.
speaker: Fiona

content: (she smiles, clears her throat, and holds out a handkerchief)
I pray that you take this favour as a token of my gratitude.
speaker: Fiona

content: Thanks!
speaker: Shrek

content: (Shrek regards the handkerchief curiously and wipes his sooty face with it, blackening it. He hands it back to an appalled Fiona, but before she can react, they are startled by the dragon's roar and she drops it to the floor)
You didn't slay the dragon?!
speaker: Fiona

content: It's on my to-do list, now come on!
speaker: Shrek

content: (Shrek grabs Fiona once again and takes off running towards the direction of the dragon's roar)
But this isn't right! You were meant to charge in, sword drawn, banner flying. That's what all the other knights did!
speaker: Fiona

content: Yeah, right before they burst into flames!
speaker: Shrek

content: (He gestures at the skeleton of a knight laying against the wall, a charred outline of a man burned into the stone behind it)
That's not the point! Ugh!
speaker: Fiona

content: (Fiona pulls her arm free from Shrek and stops running. Shrek pauses to look around and heads for a set of wooden doors)
Wait, where are you going? The exit's over there!
speaker: Fiona

content: (she points her arm to her left and Shrek turns around)
Well, I have to save my ass.
speaker: Shrek

content: What kind of knight are you?
speaker: Fiona

content: One of a kind.
speaker: Shrek

content: THRONE ROOM

(Shrek quietly pushes open the doors, stepping out onto a balcony of large spacious room. In the center of the room, Dragon has Donkey wrapped up on her tail. Dragon sits on a floor littered with a horde of gold coins and jewels)

Slow down. Slow down, baby, please. Look I believe it's healthy to get to know someone over a long period of time. Just, just call me old-fashioned. I don't want to rush into a... a physical relationship. I'm not...not emotionally ready for a commitment of, uh, this, uh - - "magnitude" really is the word I'm looking for. Magnitude.
speaker: Donkey

content: (Dragon gently caresses Donkey with a single claw)
Hey, that is unwanted physical contact. Hey, what are you doing?
speaker: Donkey

content: (Dragon looks up at the chandelier hanging above them and gently lights its candles with her fire breath)

Okay, okay. Let's just back up a little and take this one step at a time. I mean we really should get to know each other first, you know, as friends or maybe even pen pals. Y'know cause I'm on the road a lot, but I just love receiving cards to read --
speaker: Donkey

content: (Shrek jumps off the balcony, grabbing a chain connected to the chandelier. The chain does not hang low enough for him to be able to grab Donkey and he swings over Dragon. The chain swings back and he is left dangling above her)
Oh y'know I'd, I'd really love to stay, but -- (Dragon tugs at Donkey's tail with her mouth)
speaker: Donkey

content: Hey. hey don't do that! That's my tail! That's my personal tail. You're gonna tear it off. I don't give permission to-- hey! What are you gonna do with that?
speaker: Donkey

content: (Dragon purses her lips and gets ready to kiss Donkey. Shrek looks up and spots that the chain is jammed above him. He starts shaking it to try and relapse it from the pulley. Suddenly the pulley comes loose and Shrek starts falling)
Hey, now. No way. No! No! No, no! No. No, no, no. No! Oh!
speaker: Donkey

content: (Shrek lands on Donkey and bumps him out of Dragon's grasp just as she is about to kiss him, and she instead kisses Shrek's butt. She opens her eyes and roars. Shrek lets go of the chain and the chandelier falls onto her head, which acts as a collar around her neck. She roars again and Shrek and Donkey take off running. They dodge a blast of fire from Dragon. Shrek grabs Donkey in one arm and then grabs Princess Fiona, who has wandered into the room, with the other arm as he runs past her)
Hi, Princess!
speaker: Donkey

content: It talks!
speaker: Fiona

content: Yeah, it's getting him to shut up that's the trick.
speaker: Shrek

content: (They all gasp as Shrek suddenly stops, having reached the end of the balcony Shrek spots a fallen column that has formed a sort of slide. He jumps on it just as Dragon tries to bite them and slides down it. Unfortunately there is a crack in the stone and it hits Shrek right in the crotch. His eyes cross and as he reaches the bottom of the slide, he groans and stumbles off. Dragon chases after them, the chain of the chandelier still unraveling. They are chased by Dragon through a large hall, her chain looping itself around multiple stone pillars as Shrek zigzags around them. Dragon ends up in front of them and breathes fire. Shrek dodges the fire and runs away, leaping over several rows of chains. He comes to a halt)
Okay, you 2, head for the exit! (setting down Donkey and Fiona) I'll take care of the dragon.
speaker: Shrek

content: (Shrek grabs a sword lodged in the floor and sticks it through a link in the chain and deep into the floor. Shrek catches up with Donkey and Fiona, who are waiting near the exit)
Run!
speaker: Shrek

content: (They sprint as fast as they can out of the castle and onto the rickety bridge as Dragon breathes a huge fireball behind them. As they reach the middle of the bridge the fire burns the bridge and it snaps in half. They hang onto the bridge as they are swung to the other side. Donkey, unable to grab on, falls off but Shrek catches him by the leg. Fiona screams in horror as Dragon flies over the boiling lava to get them. Suddenly the chandelier pulls Dragon back, the sword having lodged itself into a stone column and getting the chain stuck. The group quickly climbs up to safety. Dragon lets out a defeated roar, then gives a sad whimper)
VOLCANO - EXTERIOR
(The first to climb out, Fiona gracefully slides down to the bottom of the volcano hill)
You did it! You rescued me! You're amazing.
speaker: Fiona

content: Behind her Donkey tumbles his way down the hill.
You're -- you're wonderful. You're...
speaker: Fiona

content: (she turns to see Shrek slide down the hill and crash into Donkey)
A little unorthodox I'll admit. But...thy deed is great, and thine heart is pure. I am eternally in your debt.
speaker: Fiona

content: Ahem...
speaker: Donkey

content: And where would a brave knight be without his noble steed?
speaker: Fiona

content: (she reaches down, squeezing Donkey's face)
I hope you heard that. She called me a noble steed. She thinks I'm a steed.
speaker: Donkey

content: (Donkey blushes, causing Fiona to chuckle and Shrek to roll his eyes)
The battle is won. You may remove your helmet, good Sir Knight.
speaker: Fiona

content: (Donkey gasps and makes eye contact with Shrek)
Uh, no.
speaker: Shrek

content: Why not?
speaker: Fiona

content: I...I have helmet hair.
speaker: Shrek

content: Please. I would'st look upon the face of my rescuer.
speaker: Fiona

content: Oh, no, you wouldn't -- st.
speaker: Shrek

content: But, how will you kiss me?
speaker: Fiona

content: What?
speaker: Shrek

content: (Shrek backs away and bumps into a wall)
(to Donkey) That wasn't in the job description.
speaker: Shrek

content: Maybe it's a perk! (suggestively raises his eyebrows)
speaker: Donkey

content: No, it's destiny. Oh, you must know how it goes: A princess locked in a tower and beset by a dragon is rescued by a brave knight, and then they share true love's first kiss.
speaker: Fiona

content: (They both give Fiona a wide-eyed look)
Hmm? With Shrek? You think --who, whoa, wait a sec. You think that Shrek is your true love?
speaker: Donkey

content: Well... yes.
speaker: Fiona

content: (Fiona sheepishly smiles at Shrek. Shrek and Donkey turn to each other and burst out laughing)
You think Shrek is your true love!
speaker: Donkey

content: (annoyed) What is so funny?
speaker: Fiona

content: Let's just say I'm not your type, okay?
speaker: Shrek

content: Of course, you are. You're my rescuer. Now--now remove your helmet.
speaker: Fiona

content: Look. I really don't think this is a good idea.
speaker: Shrek

content: Just take off the helmet.
speaker: Fiona

content: I'm not going to.
speaker: Shrek

content: Take it off.
speaker: Fiona

content: No!
speaker: Shrek

content: NOW!
speaker: Fiona

content: Okay! Easy! As you command, Your Highness.
speaker: Shrek

content: (Shrek shakes his head and takes off his helmet and reveals his ogre self. Fiona looks at him blankly, confused but not frightened. Shrek awkwardly grins)
You're...an ogre.
speaker: Fiona

content: Oh, you were expecting Prince Charming?
speaker: Shrek

content: Well --yes, actually! Oh, no. This is all wrong. You're not supposed to be an ogre! (walks off)
speaker: Fiona

content: (sighs) Princess, I was sent to rescue you by Lord Farquaad, okay? He's the one who wants to marry you.
speaker: Shrek

content: (the mention of this Lord Farquaad prompts Fiona to turn around in surprise)
Well then why didn't he come rescue me?
speaker: Fiona

content: Good question. You should ask him that when we get there.
speaker: Shrek

content: (Shrek turns and mocks Fiona while removing what little armor is still left attached to him)
But I have to be rescued by my true love! Not by some ogre and hi...hi...his pet.
speaker: Fiona

content: Well, so much for a noble steed.
speaker: Donkey

content: Look, princess, you're not making my job any easier.
speaker: Shrek

content: Well, I'm sorry, but your job is not my problem. You can tell Lord "Farquaad" that if he wants to rescue me properly, I'll be waiting for him right here.
speaker: Fiona

content: (Fiona sits down determinedly on a nearby rock)
Hey! I'm no one's messenger boy, all right? (Advancing toward her) I'm a delivery boy.
speaker: Shrek

content: You wouldn't dare.
speaker: Fiona

content: (Shrek picks Fiona up and puts her over his shoulder)
(screams) Put me down!
speaker: Fiona

content: You coming, Donkey?
speaker: Shrek

content: Oh, yep! I'm right behind ya.
speaker: Donkey

content: (Fiona is now kicking and screaming)
Put me down or you will suffer the consequences! This is not dignified! Put me down!
speaker: Fiona

content: (Fiona smacks Shrek on the back of the head and screams in frustration)
WOODS
(Hours have passed and Fiona has calmed down. She hangs limply while Shrek carries her and Donkey walks behind them)

Okay, so here's another question. Say there's a woman that digs you, right, but you don't really like her that way. How do you let her down real easy so her feelings aren't hurt, but you don't get burned to a crisp and eaten? How do you do that?
speaker: Donkey

content: You just tell her she's not your true love. Everyone knows what happens when you find your...
speaker: Fiona

content: (Shrek cuts her off with a deliberate, bouncing readjustment)
Hey! The sooner we get to Duloc the better.
speaker: Fiona

content: Oh you're gonna love it there, Princess. It's beautiful!
speaker: Donkey

content: And what of my groom-to-be? Lord Farquaad? What's he like?
speaker: Fiona

content: Well, let me put it this way, princess.
speaker: Shrek

content: (Shrek dumps Fiona to the ground unceremoniously and heads to a nearby pond to wash up)
Men of Farquaad's stature are in..."short" supply.
speaker: Shrek

content: (he chuckles and Donkey joins in)
I don't know, Shrek. There are those who think..."little" of him.
speaker: Donkey

content: (They laugh even harder)
Stop it. Stop it, both of you. You're just jealous that you can never measure up to a great ruler like Lord Farquaad.
speaker: Fiona

content: Yeah, well, maybe you're right, princess. But I'll let you do the..."measuring"...when you see him tomorrow.
speaker: Shrek

content: Tomorrow?
speaker: Fiona

content: (Panic-stricken, Fiona looks back fearfully at the setting sun)
It'll take that long? Shouldn't we stop to make camp?
speaker: Fiona

content: No, that'll take longer. We can keep going.
speaker: Shrek

content: But there's....robbers in the woods.
speaker: Fiona

content: Whoa! Time out, Shrek! Camp is definitely starting to sound good.
speaker: Donkey

content: Hey, come on. I'm scarier than anything we're going to see in this forest.
speaker: Shrek

content: (Fiona jumps in front of Shrek, blocking him)
I NEED TO FIND SOMEWHERE TO CAMP NOW!!
speaker: Fiona

content: (Both Shrek and Donkey's ears lower, taken aback by her outburst)
CLIFFSIDE
(A few minutes later, Shrek is rolling a large boulder away from the mouth of a cave)
Hey! Over here!
speaker: Shrek

content: Shrek, we can do better than that. I don't think this is fit for a princess.
speaker: Donkey

content: (Fiona turns her attention away from the setting sun)
No, no, it's perfect. It just needs a few homey touches.
speaker: Fiona

content: Homey touches? Like what?
speaker: Shrek

content: (He hears a huge ripping sound and looks over at Fiona, who has torn the bark off of a tree with her bare hands)
A door. Well, gentlemen, I bid thee good night.
speaker: Fiona

content: (She enters the cave and puts the bark door up behind her)
You want me to come in there and read you a bedtime story? 'Cause I will.
speaker: Donkey

content: I said good night!
speaker: Fiona

content: (Shrek looks at Donkey for a second and then reaches to move the boulder back in front of the entrance)
Shrek, what are you doing?!
speaker: Donkey

content: (laughs) I just--you know - - Oh, come on. I was just kidding.
speaker: Shrek

content: CLIFFSIDE - NIGHT
(Later that night Shrek and Donkey are sitting around a campfire. They gaze up into the sky as Shrek points out certain star constellations to Donkey)
And, uh, that one, that's Throwback, the only ogre to ever spit over three wheat fields.
speaker: Shrek

content: Right. Yeah. Hey, can you tell my future from these stars?
speaker: Donkey

content: The stars don't tell the future, Donkey. They tell stories. Look, there's Bloodnut the Flatulent. You can guess what he's famous for. (chuckles)
speaker: Shrek

content: Alright now I know you're making this up.
speaker: Donkey

content: No, look.
speaker: Shrek

content: (Shrek traces the constellation with his finger)
There he is, and there's the group of hunters running away from his stench.
speaker: Shrek

content: Man, that ain't nothing but a bunch of little dots.
speaker: Donkey

content: You know, Donkey, sometimes things are more than they appear. Hmm?
speaker: Shrek

content: (Shrek glances over to see if Donkey understands him, but is met with a blank look)
Forget it.
speaker: Shrek

content: Hey, Shrek, what we gonna do when we get our swamp anyway?
speaker: Donkey

content: Our swamp?
speaker: Shrek

content: You know, when we're through rescuing the princess and all that stuff.
speaker: Donkey

content: We? Donkey, there's no we. There's no our. There's just me and my swamp. And the first thing I'm gonna do is build a ten-foot wall around my land.
speaker: Shrek

content: (He turns his back on Donkey)
You cut me deep, Shrek. You cut me real deep just now.
speaker: Donkey

content: (Donkey walks over to face Shrek)
You know what I think? I think this whole wall thing is just a way to keep somebody out.
speaker: Donkey

content: No, do ya think?
speaker: Shrek

content: (Shrek turns away again)
Are you hidin' something?
speaker: Donkey

content: Never mind, Donkey.
speaker: Shrek

content: (He lies on his back. Donkey leans over him)
Oh, this is another one of those onion things, isn't it?
speaker: Donkey

content: No, this is one of those "drop it and leave it alone" things!
speaker: Shrek

content: Why don't you want to talk about it?
speaker: Donkey

content: Why do you want to talk about it? (turns)
speaker: Shrek

content: Why are you blocking?
speaker: Donkey

content: I'm not blocking! (turns)
speaker: Shrek

content: Oh, yes, you are.
speaker: Donkey

content: Donkey, I'm warning you...
speaker: Shrek

content: Who you trying to keep out?
speaker: Donkey

content: (Shrek gets on his feet and faces Donkey)
Everyone! Okay?!
speaker: Shrek

content: Oh, now we're getting somewhere.
speaker: Donkey

content: (Unseen by either of them, Fiona was peeking around the cave door, eavesdropping on the conversation)
Oh! For the love of Pete!
speaker: Shrek

content: (Shrek walks over to the edge of the cliff and sits down)
Hey what's your problem Shrek? What you got against the whole world anyway, huh?
speaker: Donkey

content: Look, I'm not the one with the problem, okay? It's the world that seems to have a problem with me. People take one look at me and go "Aah! Help! Run! A big, stupid, ugly ogre!" They judge me before they even know me. That's why I'm better off alone.
speaker: Shrek

content: (Hidden in the shadows of the cave, Fiona's eyes were sympathetic. She closes the door. Donkey stares silently at Shrek for a moment and then sits down beside him)
You know what? When we met, I didn't think you was just a big, stupid, ugly ogre.
speaker: Donkey

content: Yeah, I know.
speaker: Shrek

content: So, uh, are there any donkeys up there?
speaker: Donkey

content: Well, there's, um, Gabby...the Small...and Annoying.
speaker: Shrek

content: Okay, okay, I see it now. The big shiny one, right there. That one there?
speaker: Donkey

content: That's the moon.
speaker: Shrek

content: Oh, okay.
speaker: Donkey

content: DULOC - LORD FARQUAAD'S BEDROOM

(Lord Farquaad's room is is filled with items prepared for his wedding, including crowns and wedding outfits for him and Fiona. Mama Bear is now a taxidermized rug. Soft music plays in the background. Lord Farquaad lays in bed with the Magic Mirror set up at the foot of the bed)
Again, show me again.
speaker: Lord Farquaad

content: We hear the sound of tape rewinding.
Mirror, mirror, show her to me. Show me the princess.
speaker: Lord Farquaad

content: (uncomfortably) Hmm.
speaker: Magic Mirror

content: (The Mirror reluctantly rewinds and begins to play again from the beginning, displaying the image of Fiona waiting in her tower)
Ah...perfect.
speaker: Lord Farquaad

content: Lord Farquaad looks down  and pulls the sheet up to cover himself as the covers rise.
CLIFFSIDE - MORNING

(Fiona walks out of the cave and glances at Shrek and Donkey who are still sleeping. She wanders off into the woods, marveling at the nature, and begins to sing. A bluebird flies over to join in her song. She hits higher and higher notes and the bird struggles to keep up with her. Fiona hits a high, horrible note that causes the bird to explode. Fiona looks guilty, but she eyes the eggs that the bird left behind. A little later, Fiona is now frying the eggs over the campfire using a rock skillet. Shrek wakes up, smells the food, and takes note of Fiona. Donkey is talking to himself in his sleep)
Mmm, yeah, you know I like it like that. Come on, baby. I said I like it...
speaker: Donkey

content: Donkey, wake up. (shakes him)
speaker: Shrek

content: Huh? What?
speaker: Donkey

content: Wake up.
speaker: Shrek

content: What? (stretches and yawns)
speaker: Donkey

content: Good morning. Uhmm... how do you like your eggs?
speaker: Fiona

content: Oh, good morning, Princess!
speaker: Donkey

content: What's all this about?
speaker: Shrek

content: You know, we kind of got off to a bad start yesterday and I wanted to make it up to you. I mean, after all, you did rescue me.
speaker: Fiona

content: (Fiona gets up and sets the eggs down in front of them)
Uh, thanks.
speaker: Shrek

content: (Donkey sniffs the eggs and licks his lips)
Well, eat up. We've got a big day ahead of us.
speaker: Fiona

content: (Fiona walks off, seemingly in a better mood than yesterday. Shrek and Donkey look at each other)
SHERWOOD FOREST
(The 3 continue their journey back to Duloc though the woods. Shrek lets out a loud belch)
Shrek!
speaker: Donkey

content: What? It's a compliment. Better out than in, I always say. (laughs)
speaker: Shrek

content: Well, it's no way to behave in front of a princess!
speaker: Donkey

content: (Fiona belches, stopping Shrek and Donkey in their tracks)
Thanks.
speaker: Fiona

content: She's as nasty as you are.
speaker: Donkey

content: (chuckles) You know, you're not exactly what I expected.
speaker: Shrek

content: Well, maybe you shouldn't judge people before you get to know them.
speaker: Fiona

content: (She smiles and then continues walking, singing softly. Suddenly from out of nowhere, a man swings down and swoops Fiona away)
La liberte! Hey!
speaker: Monsieur Hood

content: Princess!
speaker: SHREK

content: (Fiona and the unknown man land on a limb high above in the trees. It is none other than Monsieur Hood, also known as Robin Hood. Fiona breaks away from Monsieur Hood, who has his hand around her waist)
Oh! Wait wait--what are you doing?!
speaker: Fiona

content: Be still, mon cherie, for I am you savior!  And I am rescuing you from this green...
speaker: Monsieur Hood

content: (Monsieur Hood brings Fiona's hand to his chest, and then carpets Fiona's arms with kisses as she pulls back in disgust)
...beast.
speaker: Monsieur Hood

content: (His smile is only met with annoyance, which confuses him)
Hey! That's my princess! Go find you own!
speaker: Shrek

content: Please, monster! Can't you see I'm a little busy here?
speaker: Monsieur Hood

content: (Fiona gives Monsieur Hood a one-handed push and jams her finger into his chest)
Look, pal, I don't know who you think you are!
speaker: Fiona

content: Oh! Of course! Oh, how rude. Please let me introduce myself.
speaker: Monsieur Hood

content: He cups his hand and calls into the woods
Oh, Merry Men! (laughs)
speaker: Monsieur Hood

content: (Suddenly an accordion begins to play and the Merrymen pop out from the bushes. They begin to sing along with Monsieur Hood)
Ta, dah, dah, dah, whoo.
speaker: Merrymen

content: I steal from the rich and give to the needy.
speaker: Monsieur Hood

content: He takes a wee percentage,
speaker: Merryman

content: But I'm not greedy. I rescue pretty damsels, man, I'm good.
speaker: Monsieur Hood

content: What a guy, Monsieur Hood.
speaker: Merrymen

content: Break it down. I like an honest fight and a saucy little maid...
speaker: Monsieur Hood

content: What he's basically saying is he likes to get...
speaker: Merrymen

content: Paid! So...When an ogre in the bush grabs a lady by the tush. That's bad.
speaker: Monsieur Hood

content: That's bad. That's bad. That's bad!
speaker: Merrymen

content: When a beauty's with a beast it makes me awfully mad!
speaker: Monsieur Hood

content: He's mad, he's really, really mad!
speaker: Merrymen

content: (Fiona, still up in the tree, looks down. Her expression changes from confusion to horror as Monsieur Hood sings the last line)
I'll take my blade and ram it through your heart, keep your eyes on me, boys 'cause I'm about to start...
speaker: Monsieur Hood

content: (Fiona swings down from the tree limb and kicks Monsieur Hood in the head, knocking him unconscious. She lands with a back flip in front of Shrek and Donkey)
Man, that was annoying!
speaker: Fiona

content: (Shrek looks at her in admiration)
Oh, you little--
speaker: Merryman

content: (The Merry Man shoots an arrow at Fiona but she ducks out of the way. The arrow flies past her and towards Donkey, who jumps into Shrek's arms to get out of the way. Fiona demonstrates her martial arts skills and easily defeats up every last Merryman. The Merrymen are left on lying on the ground and Fiona walks away. Fiona looks a little embarrassed as she smoothes out her dress and regains her composure)
Uh, shall we?
speaker: Fiona

content: Hold the phone.
speaker: Shrek

content: (Taken aback, Shrek drops Donkey and begins walking after Fiona)
Oh! Whoa, whoa, whoa. Hold on now. Where did that come from?
speaker: Shrek

content: What?
speaker: Fiona

content: That! Back there. That was amazing! Where did you learn that?
speaker: Shrek

content: (Fiona blushes)
Well...(laughs) when one lives alone, uh, one has to learn these things in case there's a...there's an arrow in your butt!
speaker: FIONA

content: (Fiona points downwards at a small arrow jutting out of Shrek's butt)
What? Oh, would you look at that?
speaker: Shrek

content: Oh, no. This is all my fault. I'm so sorry.
speaker: Fiona

content: (Shrek lightly tugs at the arrow but stops, wincing in pain. Donkey catches up to them)
Why? What's wrong?
speaker: Donkey

content: Shrek's hurt.
speaker: Fiona

content: Shrek's hurt! Shrek's hurt?!
speaker: Donkey

content: (Donkey frantically begins to scamper around)
Oh, no, Shrek's gonna die!
speaker: Donkey

content: Donkey, I'm okay.
speaker: Shrek

content: You can't do this to me, Shrek. I'm too young for you to die! Keep your legs elevated! Turn your head and cough! Does anyone know the Heimlich?!
speaker: Donkey

content: (Fiona grabs Donkey's head and pulls it down to her)
Donkey! Calm down! If you want to help Shrek, run into the woods and find me a blue flower with red thorns.
speaker: Fiona

content: Blue flower, red thorns. Okay, I'm on it. Blue flower, red thorns. Don't die Shrek.
speaker: Donkey

content: (Donkey begins to head in a random direction into the forest.)
And if you see a long tunnel, stay away from the light!
speaker: Donkey

content: Donkey!
speaker: Shrek and Fiona

content: Oh, yeah. Right. Blue flower, red thorns. Blue flower, red thorns...
speaker: Donkey

content: (Donkey marches off, still chanting, until he is out of earshot)
What are the flowers for?
speaker: Shrek

content: For getting rid of Donkey.
speaker: Fiona

content: Ah...
speaker: Shrek

content: (Shrek's confused look turns into a big grin)
Now you hold still, and I'll yank this thing out.
speaker: Fiona

content: Fiona grabs hold of the arrow and begins to pull. Shrek winces and jumps away.
Ow! Hey! Easy with the yanking!
speaker: Shrek

content: Well, I'm sorry, but it has to come out.
speaker: Fiona

content: No, it's tender.
speaker: Shrek

content: (As they continue to talk Fiona keeps grabbing after the arrow as Shrek dodges her attempts)
Now, hold still.
speaker: Fiona

content: What you're doing is the opposite of help.
speaker: Shrek

content: Don't move.
speaker: Fiona

content: Look, time out.
speaker: Shrek

content: (Shrek puts his entire hand over Fiona's face, stopping her in her tracks)
Would you...
speaker: Fiona

content: (She takes Shrek's hand off her face)
Okay. What do you propose we do?
speaker: Fiona

content: SHERWOOD FOREST - ELSEWHERE
(Deeper in the woods, Donkey is hurriedly searching for the flower)
Blue flower, red thorns. Blue flower, red thorns. Blue flower, red thorns. This would be so much easier if I wasn't color-blind! Blue flower, red thorns.
speaker: Donkey

content: (Suddenly he hears a far out yell from Shrek)
Owww!
speaker: Shrek

content: Hold on, Shrek! I'm coming!
speaker: Donkey

content: (Donkey rips a flower off a nearby bush, which happens to be a blue flower with red thorns, and takes off running)
SHERWOOD FOREST - CLEARING
(Back in the clearing, Shrek is laying on the ground facedown, while Fiona stands over him, using both hands to try to remove the arrow)
Ow! Not good.
speaker: Shrek

content: Okay. N--Okay. I can nearly see it...It's just about...
speaker: Fiona

content: Ow! Ohh!
speaker: Shrek

content: (He rolls over, knocking Fiona off her feet and causing her to land on top of him. For a moment they stare into each other's eyes)
Ahem.
speaker: Donkey

content: (They are both startled by Donkey's interruption. Donkey, with the flower dropped at his feet, gives them a suggestive look)
Nothing happened.
speaker: Shrek

content: (Shrek pushes Fiona off him and rolls over to face Donkey)
We were just, uh...
speaker: Shrek

content: Look, if you wanted to be alone, all you had to do was ask, okay?
speaker: Donkey

content: Oh, come on! That's the last thing on my mind. The princess here was just--
speaker: Shrek

content: (Fiona quickly pulls the arrow out of Shrek's butt with one great pull)
Uggghhh!
speaker: SHREK

content: (He turns to look at Fiona, who playfully shakes the arrow back and forth with a coy smile)
Ow!
speaker: Shrek

content: Hey, what's that? (chuckling) That's...is that blood?
speaker: Donkey

content: (Donkey faints and falls into a pile of leaves. Shrek picks him up and throws him over his shoulder, and the three continue on their journey. There is a montage of scenes as the group heads back to Duloc)

(The group comes to a river with no path across, though it is clearly shallow enough to walk over. Shrek climbs to the top of a tree, using his weight to cause the tree to bend over the river and form a bridge. Fiona crosses first and lays a hand on Shrek's back when she gets to the other side. Shrek grins and gets up while Donkey is still crossing, launching him back to the other side. In a field, Shrek swats away at a swarm of flies following him. Fiona grabs a nearby spiderweb from a tree branch and runs through the field, swinging it around to catch the bugs. She spins the branch to form a sort of cotton candy, and hands it to Shrek as a treat. As he walks off biting it, she licks her fingers. Shrek catches a frog and blows it up like a balloon to give to Fiona. Fiona catches a snake, blows into its mouth, fashions it into a balloon animal and presents it to Shrek. Fiona starts a playful shoving match with Shrek, with Shrek ultimately flinging her into the bushes. She throws a twig at him as they both laugh, letting go of their balloons. Donkey jumps after them)
WINDMILL - EXTERIOR

(After breaking out of the forest, the group arrives onto a small rise where an old, ruined windmill stands. The fields of Duloc stretch out before before, and further in the distance stands the Duloc Castle)
There it is, princess. Your future awaits you.
speaker: Shrek

content: That's Duloc?
speaker: Fiona

content: (Fiona stands with her arm on Shrek's, but Donkey butts in-between them. They both shrug at each other)
Yeah, I know. You know, Shrek thinks Lord Farquaad's compensating for something, which I think means he has a really...
speaker: Donkey

content: (Shrek interrupts Donkey by stepping on his foot, causing him to fall to the ground in pain. Fiona gives Shrek a suspicious look)
Oww!
speaker: Donkey

content: Um, I, uh-- I guess we better move on.
speaker: Shrek

content: Sure. But, Shrek? I'm-- I'm worried about Donkey.
speaker: Fiona

content: What?
speaker: Shrek

content: I mean, look at him. He, he doesn't look so good.
speaker: Fiona

content: (Nothing seems to be wrong with Donkey. Shrek smiles knowingly at Fiona)
What are you talking about? I'm fine.
speaker: Donkey

content: (Fiona kneels down and takes Donkey's head in her arms)
Well that's what they always say and then...then...then the next thing you know, you're on your back. Dead.
speaker: Fiona

content: You know, she's right. You look awful. Do you want to sit down?
speaker: Shrek

content: Uh, you know, I'll make you some tea.
speaker: Fiona

content: I didn't want to say nothing, but I got this twinge in my neck, and when I turn my head like this, look.
speaker: Donkey

content: (Donkey sharply leans his head to the side, letting out a loud crack)
Ow! See?
speaker: Donkey

content: (Shrek and Fiona give each happy looks, having made up an excuse to stall for time)
Who's hungry? I'll find us some dinner.
speaker: Shrek

content: I'll get the firewood.
speaker: Fiona

content: (Shrek and Fiona both walk off in separate directions)
Hey, where you going? Oh, man, I can't feel my toes! (looks down) I don't have any toes! I think I need a hug.
speaker: Donkey

content: WINDMILL - EXTERIOR - EVENING
Shrek has built a fire and is cooking something on a spit while Fiona eats.
Mmm. This is good. This is really good. What is this?
speaker: Fiona

content: Uh, weed rat. Rotisserie style.
speaker: Shrek

content: No kidding. Well, this is delicious.
speaker: Fiona

content: Well, they're also great in stews. Now, I don't mean to brag, but I make a mean weed rat stew.
speaker: Shrek

content: (Fiona smiles, but it quickly fades as she looks off at Duloc in the distance)
I guess I'll be dining a little differently tomorrow night.
speaker: Fiona

content: Maybe you can come visit me in the swamp sometime. I'll cook all kind of stuff for you. Swamp toad soup, fish eye tartare -- you name it.
speaker: Shrek

content: (Fiona is now intently looking at Shrek, smiling)
Hmmm, I'd like that.
speaker: Fiona

content: (They gaze into each other's eyes longingly)
Um...princess?
speaker: Shrek

content: Yes...Shrek?
speaker: FIONA

content: I, um, I was wondering...are you...(sighs) Are you gonna eat that?
speaker: Shrek

content: (Shrek points to her last piece of food. Fiona, expecting a different question, removes the weedrat while Shrek is annoyed by the words that couldn't come out. Fiona hands it to Shrek and he grabs onto her hand. The two slowly lean towards each other. Donkey interrupts the moment)
Man, isn't this romantic? Just look at that sunset.
speaker: Donkey

content: (Shrek and Fiona are both startled out of their moment. Fiona's mood changes and she sits up to abruptly face the sunset)
Sunset?! Oh, no! I mean, it's late. I-It's very late.
speaker: Fiona

content: (She begins backing up toward the windmill)
What?
speaker: Shrek

content: Wait a minute. I see what's going on here.
speaker: Donkey

content: (Fiona looks at Donkey and freezes with panic)
You're afraid of the dark, aren't you?
speaker: Donkey
